thread.title: TA scores big win over Fort Defiance
thread.title_full: TA scores big win over Fort Defiance

title: TA scores big win over Fort Defiance
text:
TA scores big win over Fort Defiance Mark Griffin 11:35 p.m. EDT October 9, 2015 Trenton Campbell 8 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BRIDGEWATER — Turner Ashby used some quick strike scoring en route to a big 69-19 win over Fort Defiance in high school football action Friday night. 
On a damp and rainy homecoming night at Sam Ritchie Stadium, there were lots of fireworks right from the start. 
The Knights scored just over a minute into the contest on Michael De La Cruz’s 13-yard reception from Mason Fridley to make it 7-0. Fort responded as Jared Collins raced 76 yards on the Indians’ first play and the score was 7-6 after the run failed. 
Cody Warner raced 80 yards on the kickoff and the Knights were back in front 14-6. The Indians then drove deep into Knights’ territory but fumbled at the TA 19. Fridley then hit speedster Brenan Hanifee on an 81-yard TD pass that made it 20-6. With the catch, Hanifee broke the school record for receiving yards in a season. 
The Indians came right back with a drive that resulted in a 5-yard TD run by Trenton Campbell to make it 20-12. De La Cruz then returned the kickoff 90 yards for a score and the Knights were back in front 27-12 at the end of the first. 
TA got three scores in the second with Warner scoring on runs of 10 and 94 yards and Jarrett Price added a 2-yard score and the Knights were comfortably in front 48-12 at the break. 
Collins rushed 12 times for 170 yards and Campbell had six carries for 61 yards for Fort in the first half. Warner tallied 134 yards on five rushes to pace TA. 
Hanifee completed his brilliant night with two more TD catches in the third on plays of 41 and 53. Collins scored Fort’s last points on a 39 yard run in the fourth. 
Collins had a game-high 214 yards rushing on 16 carries and two scores while Campbell added 61 yards and a touchdown for Fort. Warner paced the Knights with 148 yards on seven rushes while Hanifee had 175 yards on three catches and three scores. 
The Indians (0-6) will host Spotswood next week, while the Knights (5-2) are on the road at Waynesboro. 
FORT DEFIANCE 12 0 0 7 — 19 
TURNER ASHBY 27 21 14 7 — 69 
First quarter 
TA — De La Cruz 13 pass from Fridley (Lowry kick) 
FD — Collins 76 run (run failed) 
TA — Warner 80 kick return (Lowry kick) 
TA — Hanifee 81 pass from Fridley (run failed) 
FD — Campbell 5 run (kick failed) 
TA — De La Cruz 90 kick return (Lowry kick) 
Second quarter 
TA — Warner 10 run (Harris pass from Warner) 
TA — Warner 94 run (kick failed) 
TA — Price 2 run (Lowry kick) 
Third quarter 
TA — Hanifee 41 pass from Fridley (Lowry kick) 
TA — Hanifee 53 pass from Fridley (Lowry kick) 
Fourth quarter 
FD — Collins 39 run (Lowry kick)
